comment.text: The translation key "Header" is used to display the title of a panel or section in the UI. It appears as a label in a checkbox element and is accompanied by an image to represent the header of the embedding panel.

usage.context:
<CheckboxElement
 label={t("Common:Title")}
 onChange={onHeaderChange}
 isChecked={embeddingConfig.showTitle}
 img={theme.isBase ? HeaderUrl : HeaderDarkUrl}
 title={t("JavascriptSdk:Header")}
 description={t("JavascriptSdk:HeaderDescription")}
 />
 <CheckboxElement
 label={t("JavascriptSdk:SearchFilterAndSort")}
 onChange={onTitleChange}

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "العنوان الرئيسي" (Al-ʿunwān ar-raʾīsī) is a valid Arabic phrase, it translates more closely to 'main title' or 'primary heading'. 'Header' in a software context often refers to a specific element in the code or UI, and a more accurate translation might be something closer to 'رأس الصفحة' (raʾs as-safḥa) or a similar term that emphasizes its technical function.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'رأس الصفحة' (raʾs as-safḥa) or a similar technical term that better reflects the software context.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "머리글" is a literal translation of "header", it's not the common or idiomatic term used in software development or UI/UX contexts in Korean. "헤더" (pronounced similarly to the English "header") is the preferred and more widely understood term.

The Lao translation "ຫົວຂໍ້ເອກະສານ" (hua kho ekasarn) translates to 'document header' or 'document title', which isn't a direct or accurate translation of the English 'Header'. 'Header' in a Javascript SDK context generally refers to the header information included in a request, not a document title.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more appropriate translation might be "ຫົວຂໍ້" (hua kho) - simply 'header', or perhaps "ສ່ວນຫົວ" (suan hua) – 'header section' if more context is needed. The best option depends on how 'Header' is actually used in the Javascript SDK.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: '页眉' (yè méi) primarily translates to 'header' in the context of a document or web page's top section. While technically a 'header', it might not be the most accurate translation for a Javascript SDK's header, which likely refers to a component or section of code. A more contextually appropriate translation might be '头部' (tóu bù) which means 'head' or 'heading'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider '头部' (tóu bù) for a more accurate translation if 'header' refers to a component of a Javascript SDK.
